home.subtitle: An interactive space that curates and bringstogether creatives to ignite discovery,imagination, and conversation

intro.en:
UltraSuperNew Gallery in Tokyo and Singapore are proud to present their first inter-gallery collaborative exhibition, Hello /enter.

In effort to aid local artists in building networks outside of the country, UltraSuperNew Gallery has initiated the programme Hello /enter. This programme sees us further leveraging on the relationship of our two sister galleries in Tokyo and Singapore. It enables gallery coordinators to help connect local artists with each other across countries – a feat that would have been left up to chance. In the eight-week programme, artists will only be given public, digital information of each other (e.g. online portfolios, email addresses) and will have to reach out to each other through the Internet. At the end of the programme, artists will have to create at least one work in collaboration with each other and individual documentation of the entire programme. These will be showcased in both galleries during the exhibition that opens on 9th January 2020 and runs till 16th January 2020.

description.en: The first of its kind, the exhibition is an experimentation on collaboration of not only by the artists but also the galleries as well. This iteration of Hello /enter finds the artists exploring connections and connectivity through digital, physical and emotional distance. In combining both their practice, they utilise both site-installations and video installations in this exhibition. Taking their island countries as departure, the artists form and inform their works through what stands between them: the sky and the sea.

subtitle.en: Casimir Simon, Chee Yang Han, Kiat Tan W.J., Marcus Ian, Wayne Lim

intro.en: The nationstate is one that is complex and multifaceted. The glory of peace and harmony did not come easy, as people have come together united despite obstacles and hardships through meritocratic efforts, in a place that has been shaped, and polished in myriad of ways. Yet, boundaries have been both respected and overstepped, as there are still everyday experiences enforced by social markers, policies, infrastructures and logistics that go beyond the naked eye. Regardless of race, language or religion, they serve (in)discriminately and diligently in ways we do not always hear about. Though, in the grand scheme of things, we sometimes slip, and actions have gone unchecked — with feelings growing more ambivalent than ever.

description.en:
Four designers and one artist come together to question what it means to create artworks and if design can also push the boundaries of what art-making can be. Reflective of the political correctness within our nation, Casimir, Yang, Kiat, Marcus and Wayne explores notions of art-making, identity building and who they can be as makers.

TOUR WITH THE CREATIVES
15th December 2019, Sunday, 2pm and 4pm.

intro.en:
In this three-way collaboration, one tries to remember, one cannot recall and one is attempting to forget. We explore the memories of the collective and see how traces of events and people linger in the mind. In the passing faces of people we encounter, do we notice them despite how our minds store such information without us consciously knowing?

CONVERSATION WITH THE ARTISTS
26th November, Tuesday, 7.30pm till 9.00pm

subtitle.en: Anna Chan, Dipali Gupta, Fazleen Karlan, Maisarah Kamal

intro.en: To make sense of the world, we label and are labelled. To connect with others and form bonds, we live within the labels that are given to us, be it by ourselves or by others. A cycle forms where our perceived identities informs others of who we are, and their reaction to us, informs the self. It begs the question then: do we create our own identity, or is it created upon the experiences we have?

description.en:
People’s perception of us becomes a check by which we enact upon how we would like to be seen. In these categorisations of ourselves, there are those that drown in the attempt to convince the world who they are supposed to be. Their refusal to be reduced to singular terms is an insistent demand to be recognised for their multiplicity.

Yet, in identifying with labels, there is empowerment in language for many whom for so long lack the words to speak for themselves. It is an endless journey of discovery, answering to baggage of histories that come with such terminologies.

What happens then when we dare to go beyond these labels? Do our identities fall apart? Is it not possible to simply exist or are we too tied up by the descriptions that they inevitably inform our identities?

I am, but also follows four women as they explore beyond the labels they inhabit, overcoming the ways they have been restricted and seeking ways of empowerment through their identities.

Conversations with the Artist
17th September 2019, Tuesday, 7.30pm till 9.30pm

USN Free School: Marla Bendini’s Magic Marker Party
24th September 2019, Tuesday, 7.30pm till 9.30pm

title.en: Liquid Porosity [FIRE EXTINGUISHER] garang guni buddy.

intro.en: Come see the culmination of Lim Charlotte’s enquiry into the depths of innocence versus experiences within the confines of the city state, as a subject and object, self and other. Fusing the various dichotomies and contradictions of the examined life, Lim Charlotte pits it against that which makes little sense unless the gaze is averted.

description.en:
Systems of measurements speak to larger concepts of time. The linear boundaries of our physical relationship and existence with and in time, reduces lives to a singular digit. It is a stark parallel to technology in modernity. Despite the rise of digital social mobility, the various classes of ‘society’ attain access to varying degrees of exposure according to their social status. Exposures which do not necessarily intersect apart from the superficial. Who controls the distribution of information? The notion of self is enslaved by knowledge to maintain and perpetuate power and financial imbalance in the socio-political landscape. Semantics have become a tool for ostracisation, discrediting the voices and narratives of the non-elites, the ‘outsiders’.

Singapore-based, multimedia visual artist, Lim Charlotte has exhibited at UltraSuperNew Gallery (Singapore), Gajah Gallery, Institute of Contemporary Arts Singapore (ICAS), Aliwal Arts Centre, Kult Gallery and Goodman Arts Centre and was awarded the 30 Art Friends Scholarship in 2015.

subtitle.en: Candace Granfelt, George Killeen, Georgia Mars, Adeline Lim, Jen Rogan, Jose Coad, Sarah Dutta, Ben de Quadros-Wander

intro.en: 8 is an exhibition bringing together the talents of 8 international artists, now based in Singapore. Between them, these artists have lived and worked in a multitude of countries around the world and developed rich cultural understandings which have helped them to interpret their own place in the world. Their varied experiences define not only the ways in which they create, but the enthusiasm they all have for sharing their artistic endeavours with others.

description.en:
With a wide range of media and styles, this exhibition showcases the differences that exist between all people. Each artist brings their unique perspective of the world in which they live. By celebrating the differences of these artists, we are celebrating the diversity of humanity. Yet, as with all humans, there are shared understandings to which we can relate. 8 is a celebration of that shared humanity. In the words of Aristotle,
“The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.”

intro.en: “As two individuals whose professional practices are placed at opposite ends of the visual arts spectrum – Design and Fine Arts, our own artistic practices meet somewhere in the middle with the craft of weaving. This commonality led us to come together to question the place of our practices within the intersections of contemporary art, design and craft. Craft or “being crafty” is commonly devalued in the fields of Design and Fine Arts. We would like to bring into view a technique that is traditionally employed by females whose heritage and cultures are embedded in the craft practices.”

The tale of the quest for identity through self and another.

What defines an artist? Who is the artist? Who am I? The quest for identity through our history and the collective one, the one of the place where we live, of where we were born, of our culture. Both the individual and collective history leave a mark on the architecture, our surroundings as well as on our body and face.

description.en: Nowadays, art raises a new issue to a layman audience: “if I don’t know, I can’t understand”. The artist is beyond understanding, beyond reach. What if the knowledge came from the audience? What if understanding yourself and art was possible through the point of view of other? The artist and the audience all together, one and the other a source of inspiration. Both actor and spectator.

subtitle.en: Muhammad Farhan Bin Osman & Amirnorashid Bin Amari

intro.en:
‘THE BOAT THAT MOVES FORWARD’ REVEALS THE UNTOLD DAILY BATTLES OF ROHINGYA CHILDREN

“The Boat That Moves Forward” is a photographic series from two Singaporean photographers that represents the reality of Rohingya children in the refugee camps.

description.en:
In August 2017, Myanmar’s army launched a violent crackdown in its Rakhine State, forcing an estimated 700,000 Rohingya people to flee to Bangladesh to escape the persecution and destruction of their homes. Over half of these stateless Muslim minorities are children. Today, they live in horrific conditions in refugee camps spread across Cox’s Bazar in Bangladesh.

Having won the 2014 and 2017 Moscow International Foto Awards respectively, FARN and AM seek to transport viewers into the shocking reality of Rohingya children living under these unimaginable environments through the language of crisis photography. They believe that it is a powerful and compelling medium capable of transcending language barriers and human emotion, instantly reminding us of the humanity and individuality of each child.

Combining their distinct styles of black and white imagery across analogue and digital photography, their deeply emotional work echoes universal themes of hope and struggle. The images serve to convey and facilitate important dialogue on the young refugee status and experience, giving voices to those without. Capturing vulnerable moments in first person perspective, the images connect the viewers to the harsh and uncomfortable living conditions of the Rohingya children, something that is too appalling to be merely expressed with words.

In these photographs, the viewers are not just seeing refugees, but children full of hopes and dreams. Children who are robbed of a safe and fulfilling childhood, unsure of their future. “The Boat That Moves Forward” bridges this gap and unfolds the resilience of these young refugees — that despite these circumstances, they continue to move forward.

intro.en: ‘The Vaguely immortal Art Exhibition’ is a collaboration between two African artists, Alexander De Oliveira and Delcio Henjengo. The works showcased are personal documentations of each artists travels, experiences and what they believe it means to express oneself freely, challenging the senses of the viewer and the artists themselves.

LIM CHARLOTTE TURNS FRAGILITY INTO POWER WITH FIRST SOLO EXHIBITION, ‘IN VAIN IN VANITY’

IN VAIN IN VANITY showcases Lim Charlotte’s body of work which has two separate and distinct themes – strife in intimacy and the elucidation of self defying sexual affirmation. Dealing with the human body, Charlotte acknowledges that it can be symbolically dismantled and remodelled; and be grounded in new meaning. Recognising the notions of scale within spaces all matter inhabit; the minuscule, the vast, and everything in between, IN VAIN IN VANITY creates a dialogue around the fragility of traditionalism – striving to become both the content and its critique, adhering to classical norms while admonishing them.

Don’t miss Jan Larsen’s colourful, cool and catchy Neo-Pop exhibition that captures the contemporary American experience in all its grit-and-glory.

With this latest international exhibition, the ‘Young Americans Tour’ features the artist’s meditations on his America – the open, honest and inclusive land of opportunity – and the ‘real’ America – the good, the bad and now, unfortunately, some of the ugly.

description.en: In line with his reflections on the character of the ‘real’ America, Larsen, HG Contemporary and UltraSuperNew Gallery will dedicate a portion of the sponsorship and sales proceeds from the show to legal-aid charity RAICES (Refugee and Immigrant Center for Education and Legal Services), a US non-profit that provides free / low-cost legal services to underserved immigrant / refugee families in Central and South Texas, along the United States’ southern border with Mexico.

intro.en:
Curated by Milenko Prvački, and featuring work by artists, Joel Chin, Goh Abigail, Tinu Verghis, Ryf Zaini, and Urich Lau Wai Yuen, Mixed Up marks the opening of UltraSuperNew’s brand new gallery and performance space. The artists use technological tools, sculpture and performance to question issues with a diverse range of sources. The exploration of a myriad of concepts in a hybrid manner and metaphorical way adds to the expansion of playful possibilities, creating the mixed up form.

Mixed Up intends to go against the conventional flow of presenting “good” art within the cube. The presentation is an exploration of contemporary art practice in an unusual space with unconventional narratives, and contrary notions of “official” and “correct”.

Wataboku represents a new generation of digital artists from Japan, exploring themes of nostalgia, freedom and mystery while echoing themes in popular Japanese culture such as the cinema and comic culture.

In the chasing of dreams, there is no map. Every moment renders other moments futile.

Uncharted is an installation by the artists Daphne Kang and Danisha Liang. Using twine, food colouring, brick and gravity, the installation traces the flow of information, argument and influence – each strand depicting a universe of confusion, controlled excitement, and the real possibility of eventual mediocrity.

Logic Chromatic’ is the first major solo show by Soph O investigating the push and pull between the natural organic world and our constructed, man-made realities.

The new body of work presented draws reference from the artist’s constant preoccupation with her own psychological and physical displacement, inviting dialogue around the themes of lived vs. imagined realities, the notion of ‘unnatural nature’ as well as evolutionary dislocation.

Soph O explores these themes through her experimentation with form, materials and processes, creating an immersive show of paintings, illustrations, works on wood and site-specific installations.

UltraSuperNew is proud to host Automarktic, visual artist Juls’ first solo show in Singapore. Fresh from an artist residency in Taiwan, this show is part of an ongoing investigation for Juls as she finds new marking patterns, strokes and techniques to create different textures for her large-scale wall paintings.

description.en:
Using the space as her canvas, viewers are immersed in the work and able to juxtapose their appreciation of each hand-marked stroke on the wall with those on the hanging canvas and paper pieces. Through this exercise, she hopes for viewers to have a visceral understanding of what she experienced when creating the work.

The show features 20+ pieces of varying sizes (paint marker on paper, pencil on paper, and paint maker on canvas), which hang amidst a massive mural enveloping the gallery, and a time-lapse video projection documenting the wall-marking process played on loop.

intro.en:
Whack Only: a show dedicated to skateboarding

This exhibition brings together a group of skateboarders who engage with the culture beyond riding a skateboard. In other words, skaters who make shit inspired by skateboarding.

description.en:
It’s funny how a wooden toy has spawned an entire culture that revolves around it. Operating beyond class, race, nationality or language. It brings people together, and (we) the people make drawings, paintings, photographs, videos and objects that pay tribute to it.

The title says it all – Whack Only – we never sought out to become illustrators, painters, photographers, videographers or craftsmen. We simply just whack only, trying and trying till we eventually became good at it (sort of). Skateboarding has given us some of the best times of our lives, so this is our way of giving back.

This event is:
NOT part of the Singapore Night Festival 2017
NOT supported by the National Arts Council

intro.en:
UltraSuperNew presents visual artist and motion graphics designer Reza Hasni’s first solo show. A humorous mystical meditation filled with stories, legends and myths, Reza is showing a broad range of work across various mediums spanning ink on paper and ceramics, gouache on paper, and digital prints on cotton and silk textiles. A collage of all the tales he is presenting, the show also features an interactive mural inviting viewers to complete the artwork by applying colour to the piece.

All artworks on show are one of a kind and available for sale.

From June 7th (Tue) to June 12th (Sun) 2022, UltraSuperNew Gallery Harajuku will present “水彩祭 -Watercolor Festival-”, a group watercolor exhibition featuring 7 different artists. June in Japan means the start of rainy season, rainy season means water, and water means watercolor!
intro.jp: 2022年6月7日(火)〜6月12日(日)の期間、原宿UltraSuperNew Galleryではアーティスト7名による水彩画のグループ展「水彩祭 -Watercolor Festival-」を開催いたします。6月と言えば梅雨入り、梅雨といえばウォーター、ウォーターと言えば水彩！

description.en:
Known for being a challenging medium that does not allow for mistakes, watercolor can be stunningly beautiful if done properly. In this exhibition, each artist will showcase the beauty of watercolor through their own unique style and technique.

Come by and refresh yourself with the soft and gentle watercolor illustrations that will be on exhibit!
description.jp:
失敗が許されない難しい技法として知られてる水彩画は、正しく描けば驚くほど美しく仕上がるのです。本展では、各画家が独自のスタイルと技法で水彩画の美しさを表現します。

柔らかくて爽やかな水彩画をご覧になって、リフレッシュしてみるのはいかがですか?

title.en: Exercise in Unlocking Heteronormativity, part II
title.jp: 異性愛規範を解きほぐすためのエクササイズ、パート2

intro.en: In association with the LGBTQIA+ festival “Q(WE)R” and gallery “The Container”, UltraSuperNew Gallery Harajuku will host the group exhibition “Exercise in Unlocking Heteronormativity, part II” from April 26th (Tue) to May 6th (Fri) 2022. The exhibition will feature works from 8 different LQBTQIA+ artists, and will explore a variety of means to negotiate issues relating to social minorities, gender, and sexual identity.
intro.jp: LGBTQIA+フェスティバル「Q(WE)R」とギャラリー「The Container」との協力により原宿UltraSuperNew Galleryでは2022 年4月26日(火)〜2022年5月6日(金)の期間、グループ展「異性愛規範を解きほぐすためのエクササイズ、パート2」を開催いたします。本展ではLQBTQIA+アーティスト8名が参加し、社会的マイノリティ、ジェンダー、性的アイデンティティに関する問題を交渉するための様々な手段を探ります。

description.en:
Presenting works in sculpture, installation, video, painting, painting, and text, viewers are invited to delve into the personal and intimate worlds of the artists as means to reflect and engage through artmaking their notions of queerness — examining contemplation and joy.

In addition, a reception party will be held on April 29th (Fri) from 19:00〜22:00, as well as a live performance featuring 4 artists on May 3rd (Tue) from 19:00〜23:00. We look forward to your visit!

intro.en:
For two days from March 5th (Sat) to March 6th (Sun) 2022, UltraSuperNew Gallery Harajuku will present photographer Shinichi Ichikawa’s photo exhibition “Mistaken Connections”.

Shinichi Ichikawa’s exhibition will feature individual human body photographs of 50 different people of various ages, ethnicities, and sexualities pieced together into a single abstract work.
intro.jp:
2022年3月5日(土)から2022年3月6日(日)の2日間、カメラマン市川森一による写真展「Mistaken Connections」が原宿UltraSuperNew Galleryにて開催されます。

市川森一は、年齢、人種、セクシュアリティの異なる50人の人体写真を一枚一枚つなぎ合わせて、ひとつの抽象的な形にした作品を展示します。

description.en:
By viewing the forms of each body, we can get a small glimpse into the lives and identities of each individual. The human body and skin is essentially engraved with the way we have all lived our lives. Through piecing together each photo, a distorted and slightly grotesque mass is formed, while still maintaining the individuality and diversity of each person photographed.

Shinichi Ichikawa’s exhibition aims to treat each individual equally, respecting each person’s way of thinking, life, and background in a uniform manner.
description.jp:
それぞれの身体のフォルムを見ることで、一人ひとりの人生やアイデンティティを少しだけ垣間見ることができます。人間の身体や皮膚には、本来、私たち一人ひとりの生き様が刻み込まれています。それぞれの写真をつなぎ合わせることで、撮影された人物の個性や多様性を保ちつつ、歪んだ、少しグロテスクな塊が形成されるのです。

市川森一の展示会では、一人ひとりを平等に扱い、それぞれの考え方や生き方、背景を尊重しながら、統一された形で展示することを目指しています

intro.en:
kame湯 初個展「Recall」を2022年2月22日~2月27日に開催します。本個展では、水彩画の原画を展示、販売予定です。

「最近、16年間飼っていた犬が亡くなった。犬との思い出を振り返ってみても、あまりにも一緒にいた時間が当たり前すぎて、一瞬一瞬の出来事を思い出すことはできなかった。
intro.jp:
kame湯 初個展「Recall」を2022年2月22日~2月27日に開催します。本個展では、水彩画の原画を展示、販売予定です。

「最近、16年間飼っていた犬が亡くなった。犬との思い出を振り返ってみても、あまりにも一緒にいた時間が当たり前すぎて、一瞬一瞬の出来事を思い出すことはできなかった。

description.en:
私は昔から骨董市や古着屋に出向くなど、古いものに関心があった。人々に忘れ去られたものを拾い上げて、価値を見出す文化に惹かれている。

記憶の中で忘却され、拾い上げられなかったものと、かつて忘却されていたが、この時代に拾い上げられたもの。両者のことを思いながら絵を描いた。」
description.jp:
私は昔から骨董市や古着屋に出向くなど、古いものに関心があった。人々に忘れ去られたものを拾い上げて、価値を見出す文化に惹かれている。

記憶の中で忘却され、拾い上げられなかったものと、かつて忘却されていたが、この時代に拾い上げられたもの。両者のことを思いながら絵を描いた。」

title.jp: ウルトラスーパーぬいぐるみ

subtitle.jp: 作家・アーティスト8名

intro.en: From January 25th (Tue) – January 30th (Sun) 2022 UltraSuperNew Gallery Harajuku will present “UltraSuperNuigurumi”, a stuffed animal exhibition of 8 creators & artists. Often thought of primarily as toys, stuffed animals are also a form of art. This of course also includes the production process that goes into making a stuffed animal. Loved by children and adults alike, stuffed animals can be enjoyed in a variety of ways, such as displaying them in a collection case or on a shelf, sleeping with them in your bed, or holding them in your hand and going out with them if you’re brave. If you’re looking for a warm fluffy stuffed animal to cuddle in the middle of winter, this is the perfect opportunity! You are sure to find a stuffed animal that you’ll love at “UltraSuperNuigurumi”.
intro.jp: 2022年1月25日(火)〜2022年1月30日(日)の期間、原宿UltraSuperNew Galleryでは作家・アーティスト8名によるぬいぐるみ展「ウルトラスーパーぬいぐるみ」を開催いたします。主におもちゃだと思われることが多いぬいぐるみは、アートの一種でもあります。ぬいぐるみを作るまでの制作工程ももちろんアートです。子供から大人まで愛されるぬいぐるみは、コレクションケースの中や棚の上に飾る、ベッドの中で一緒に寝る、勇気を出して手に持ち一緒にお出かけするなど、様々なお楽しみ方があります。寒い真冬にこそふわふわで暖かいぬいぐるみを抱きしめたい方には是非！「ウルトラスーパーぬいぐるみ」では、きっとお好きなぬいぐるみが見つかるはずです。

poster.thumbnail: ../content/desktop/tokyo/thumbs/342_ウルトラスーパーぬいぐるみ.jpg
poster.blur: ../content/desktop/tokyo/blur/342_ウルトラスーパーぬいぐるみ.jpg

title.en: Nico Perez solo exhibition: Havana Cuba “The Reprint”
title.jp: Nico Perez solo exhibition: Havana Cuba “The Reprint”

intro.en:
I had an exhibition earlier in the year in February/March 2021 which for me personally was an important visual piece to share. It was an emotional expression and there was a ‘blue’ I wanted to show in that work. As this year progressed I found myself looking for the colour in life and I started to look back and remember a trip I had taken for an assignment for TRANSIT magazine 4 years ago. At the time it was January in Tokyo, Winter. I was living through a particularly hard experience in life and was desperate to breathe a different air. I was very fortunate to find my self on the other side of the world in Havana, Cuba on this assignment. I was overwhelmed by the streaks of light and colour I saw around me, the warmth and the energy. I immediately knew I had to share this experience in the exact way I felt it. Spontaneous splashes of light, expressive colours flowing into the photographs as they flowed through me as I embraced the energy around me.

Thank you Havana, Cuba.
intro.jp:
2021年2月から3月にかけて開催した展示会では、個人的に大切な ビジュアル作品を共有することができました。それは感情的な表現であり、作品には私が見せたい「青」がありました。今年に入り、私は人生の色を探していることに気づきました。そして、4年前に雑誌『TRANSIT』で行った旅を振り返りました。当時の東京 は1月、冬。人生で特に辛い時期にいた私は、違う空気を吸いたくて必死でした。幸運にも、この仕事のおかげで、私はいつの間にか地球の反対側のキューバのハバナにいたのです。周りに見える一筋の光と色、暖かさ、そしてエネルギーに圧倒されました。すぐに、この体験を感じたままに伝えなければいけない。そう思いました。自然に飛び散る光、表情豊かな色が写真の中に流れ込ん でいます。周りにあるエネルギーを受け入れながら、それらが私の中に流れていったときのように。

ありがとう、キューバのハバナ。

intro.en:
OVERWHELMED

-to be overwhelmed-

When I see a landscape with an endless horizon, when I visit a shrine or a church, when I feel a great presence or have an intense experience, I feel a sensation that cannot be put into words. I have always been in pursuit of such sensations. Other worldly things like societal criticism, enlightenment, and contextual things are frivolous and bore me. As of now, I simply make what I want to see and find those who can relate to my works. I’m going to break through the years of living as a designer and make this my new true starting point. With this initial impulse in mind, I will exhibit the three-dimensional works that I have been creating for about two years, which I can call my own.
intro.jp:
OVERWHELMED
-うちひしがれる-

地平線が果てしなく広がる景色を見たとき、神社や教会へ行ったとき、何か大きな存在を感じたとき、鮮烈な体験をしたとき、言葉では表せない感覚がかけめぐる。
そんな感覚をずっと追い求めている。社会への批評だの、啓蒙だの、文脈だの、そんな浮世だったものはつまらない。
今はただ観たいものを作り、それに共感してくれる人を探している。
長らくデザイナーとしての皮をかぶって生きてきた中で積み重なっていった年輪を打ち破り、ここを本当の自分の原点とする。
そんな初期衝動を抱き作り進んできた約2年間の、自分自身ともいえる立体作品達を展示する。

intro.en: From 10/26 to 10/31 UltraSuperNew Gallery Harajuku will present “Anything Goes”, a group exhibition of 7 artists. Interesting! Beautiful! A little strange! We will deliver an exhibition of anything and everything. Each part of the gallery will have a different atmosphere depending on each artist’s unique style and means of expression, making this an exhibition that you will never get tired of seeing. Please stop by and say hi!
intro.jp: 10/26-10/31の期間、アーティスト7名によるグループ展「Anything Goes」が原宿UltraSuperNewギャラリーにて開催されます。面白い！ステキ！ちょっと変わった！なんでもありな展示をお届けします。各アーティストの印象的なスタイル・表現手段によってギャラリースペースの各場所の雰囲気が異なる、見ても飽きない展示になります。お近くの方はどうぞお立ち寄り下さい！

title.en: Mameko Maeda First Solo Exhibition “Lovely Tempo”

intro.en: Mameko Maeda began her career as an illustrator from 2020. Being inspired by various fields such as music, dance, fashion, anime, subcultures, and philosophy, she creates characters and imaginary spaces that draw inspiration from her influences. In this exhibition she will have over 30 pieces on display including her series of works depicting fashionable people, shaped panel pieces, and her previous works displayed at hotel norm in June 2021. A zine containing a compilation of her works will be for sale, as well as other goods.
intro.jp: 前田豆コは2020年より活動を開始したイラストレーター。音楽やダンス、ファッション、アニメ、サブカルチャー、哲学など、様々な分野から刺激を受けてイメージを引き出し、キャラクターや架空の空間などを描いている。本展では、ファッショナブルな人々を描いたシリーズやシェイプドパネル作品、今年の6月にhotel norm.で展示した原画作品など、30点以上の作品が展示予定。また、作品をまとめたZINEやグッズの販売も行う。

title.en: Sakura first solo exhibition: Brand-new Puzzle
title.jp: Sakura first solo exhibition: Brand-new Puzzle

intro.en:
Graphic artist Sakura will have her first solo exhibition “Brand-new Puzzle” on display at UltraSuperNew Gallery in Harajuku from 8/20-9/3. With her art often being influenced and reminiscent of California culture, her solo exhibition will also focus on her life in Japan and the things close to her.

In the midst of the changes in our lives and environment, Sakura’s works will showcase her life perspective as she spends her days like a puzzle, gradually piecing together new ways of living.
intro.jp:
原宿UltraSuperNew Galleryでは8/20-9/3の期間、グラフィックアーティストSakuraの初個展「Brand-new Puzzle」を開催します。普段はカリフォルニアの文化から影響を受けた作品を制作する中、今回の個展では日本で過ごす時間や身近にあるものに焦点を当てた作品も展示します。

生活の変化や、環境の変化の中で、新しい方法を少しずつ組み立てていくパズルのような毎日を過ごしているSakuraの視点が描かれています。

title.jp: RICK solo Exhibition「通行止メに反抗期。」

intro.en: During his career as an artist, Rick has held great aspirations and ideals for himself, yet has felt his potential limited by his inner thoughts telling him “I can’t do it”, before attempting the challenges facing him. This exhibition represents a defiance against the previous barriers created in his mind through his new style of expression created in 2021.
intro.jp: 自分の人生のあらゆる事において、心の内には大きな理想を持っているにもかわらず「でも自分には出来ない事だから」と自らを停止させてしまい、挑戦せずに未来を潰してしまう事が幾度となくありました。この展示は、そんなアーティスト／イラストレーターのリックが、長らく自ら課せ続けてしまっていた「通行止め」に反抗し、もがき作りあげた2021年の表現スタイルの記録です。

description.en: Rick’s exhibition at UltraSuperNew Gallery from August 14th (Sat) to August 18th (Wed) will include works displayed through SNS platforms, as well as a retrospective of his layered acrylic art displayed at artgallery opaltimes in Osaka. The main visual of the exhibition represents a defiant struggle between a service worker who has renounced the barriers facing her, and the gatekeeper Cerberus.
description.jp: 8/14(土)〜8/18(水)にUltraSuperNew Galleryで開催される展示はSNSで発表した作品を中心に、大阪artgallery opaltimesでの合同展「メサイア」で出展した、レイヤーアクリルアートなどが並ぶ回顧録となります。メインヴィジュアルには、通行止めを放棄した整備員と門番ケルベロスの、反抗のもがきが描かれています。

intro.en:
Press Preview and VIP day event is invite only.

Closed Dates: July 12 – July 16, 2021 (the exhibition will temporarily close during these dates and reopen to the public on July 17, 2021)

CrypTOKYO will give Japan’s art lovers, tech heads, and investors a one-of-a-kind chance to learn the history of NFTs, experience the technology, and meet its future stars. This will be the first ever NFT gallery show in Japan making history in this new and booming culture of digital art. CrypTOKYO is curated by the experts at Blockchain Art Exchange (BAE) a leading NFT marketplace, in partnership with GrowYourBase (GYB), an NFT Membership site, who are both accelerating the NFT revolution.
intro.jp:
プレス プレビューと VIP デーのイベントは招待制です。

休館日：2021年7月12日～7月16日（期間中臨時休館、2021年7月17日より一般公開）

CrypTOKYOは、日本のアート愛好家、テックマニア、投資家が NFT の歴史を学ベるだけでなく、テクノロジーを体験しながら、未来のスターに会える機会を提供します。 NFT の主要マーケットプレイスであるBlockchain Art Exchange (BAE)の専門家たちと、 NFT の革命を加速させているメンバーシップ サイト、GrowYourBase (GYB)の協力によってキュレーションされており、急成長しているデジタルアートに歴史を刻む、日本初の NFT 展覧会です。

description.en:
Opening to the public on Saturday, June 26th, 2021, the exhibition will run for three weeks and include special event days with artist talks, NFT talks, and new NFT art to be unveiled. The multi-sensory exhibit features NFT art from some of Japan’s most notable artists as well as international icons with headlining artists: DA.YO.NE by Yasumasa Yonehara, A Love Movement by Testsu, Ichi Hatano, Beeple, Robness Cyberpop, Botchy-Botchy, Maxim. It tells the history of NFTs from its simple beginnings as flashy GIFs, through the trash art and vapour wave movements, to the 3D and concept styles now sweeping the community. Visitors will be able to view rare artwork, purchase sought-after pieces, and learn how to successfully build their NFT portfolios. Ultimately, the show aims to “bring it all home” helping visitors find multiple layers of utility in the artwork, and imagine it displayed in their own homes.

NFT technology has swept across the Western world and is now landing fast in the East. It frees artists from the power brokers and corporations that dictate tastes, trends, and sales. Beyond form it connects fans and collectors directly with artists, by allowing individuals access to opportunities they would not have traditionally had access to. Crypto Art and NFTs expand and democratize art in wholly new ways. CrypTOKYO exists at these crossroads of tech, art, culture, and finance.
description.jp:
2021年6月26日の土曜日に一般公開され、3週間にわたって開催されるこの 展覧会は、アーティストトークや NFT トーク、そして新しい NFT アートの 発表をする特別なイベントです。五感を刺激する今回の展覧会では、 米原康正、A Love Movement by Testu、Ichi Hatano、Beeple、 Robness Cyberpop、Botchy-Botchy、Maxim など、日本で高い知名度を 誇る気鋭のアーティスト、 話題の国際的なアーティストの作品を展示します。 GIFから始まり、トラッシュ アートやヴェイパーウェイヴを通じて、今では コミュニティを席巻している 3D やコンセプトスタイルにたどり着いた NFT の歴史をご紹介します。訪問された方々は、珍しい作品を観覧しながら、 気に入った作品が購入でき、NFT ポートフォリオをうまく構築する方法を 学ぶことができます。最終的に、このショーは「すべて持ち帰る」 ということを目的に、訪問者が作品に何層もの有用性を見出し、自身の家に飾ることを想像できるイベントにしています。

Cr ypTOKYOは、テクノロジー、アート、カルチャー、ファイナンスの 交差点に存在します。NFT の技術は西洋を席巻し、アジア各国で急速に
広まっています。従来、個人ではアクセスできなかった機会もアクセスできるようになり、ファンやコレクターとアーティストが直接つながることで、権力を持ったアートブローカーや企業の縛りから解放されるように
なりました。これにより、アートの市場はもっと自由になり、さらに身近なものになってきています。

subtitle.en: Organized by the Embassy of Congo
subtitle.jp: Organized by the Embassy of Congo

intro.en: Yumiko Takabayashi has always had a genuine interest in Africa and a keen enthusiasm for the Democratic Republic of Congo in particular. This passion was revealed in the summer of her sophomore year while in contact with a Congolese language teacher, Kalenga Ngoy. Since then, she has been amazed by the culture, energy and passion of the Congolese people. However, given she had never visited Congo before, the realistic image of the country was difficult to grasp. She was thus inspired to express her curiosity and love for the country by painting images of Congolese folktales and fables to tell stories as well as promote cultural exchanges between Japan and Congo.
intro.jp:
大学2年生の夏、コンゴ民主共和国（以下コンゴ）出身の英語の先生と初めて話した日からこの国に興味を持ち始めた髙林優美子さん。それから彼女はコンゴの人々や文化に触れ合うたびに、独特なエネルギーに惹かれていました。

コンゴに行った事のなかった彼女にとって、アフリカやコンゴという地の現実や日常は想像ができずイメージがしにくいものでした。しかし、だからこそ”日常”を見てみたいという思いからコンゴの昔話・民謡に興味を持ち、日本とコンゴの文化交流の一つとしてコンゴの昔話をベースに絵本を作ることに決めました。

description.en: Using watercolor painting and art, Yumiko gives life to thousands of years of Congolese history and culture, which is passed from generation to generation. She displays, with an extraordinary variety of genres and styles the works of ‘Leopard King’ along with an original story ‘Okapi and the Pursuit of Happiness’, a collaborative effort between Yumiko and Kilele Muzaliwa. The exhibition highlights the richness of collaboration and a symbiosis of Japanese and Congolese techniques.
description.jp: 昔話とはその国の精神性を世代から世代へと伝えるものです。私たちはアートを通して何千年の歴史と文化に触れ、再び息を吹き込みます。 今回の展覧会では、「Leopard King」やオリジナルストーリーの「Okapi and the Pursuit of Happiness」など、非常に多彩なジャンルとスタイルの作品が展示されており、日本とコンゴの豊かさを伝えながら芸術を通して両国のコラボレーションを鮮やかにしたいです。

intro.en: Internationally renowned for not only character and interior design but also illustrations, Tsuyoshi Nigamushi will present a gallery of art under theme of “That Girl” from May 18 (Tuesday) to May 25 (Tuesday).
intro.jp: 国内外でキャラクターデザインや内装、オリジナルグッズなどの制作活動の傍ら、絵描きとして活躍する苦虫ツヨシが描き続けてきた「あの子」をテーマとした個展を5月18日(火)から5月25日(火)まで開催いたします。

description.en:
The “That Girl” series was created several years ago, featuring girls showing a myriad of expressions drawn from various sources of inspiration. Their vaguely nostalgic air and impish, animal-like charm will entice you to their presence. Be sure to come down to the exhibition to meet them yourself.

The works will feature works of all sorts of mediums from watercolors to gouache to spray art to colored pencils, and even sculptures. Exclusive pieces made for this exhibition at UltraSuperNew Gallery will also be on display.
description.jp:
様々なインスピレーションから生まれた多彩な表情を持つ女の子達を、苦虫ツヨシが数年前から描いている「あの子」シリーズ。どこかノスタルジックな空気を纏い、ちょっと小悪魔的で、小動物的な魅力もあり、つい気になってしまう存在。どんな「あの子」と出会えるかは、会場にぜひ足をお運びいただき、お楽しみください。

水彩絵の具、ガッシュ、スプレー、色鉛筆などで制作された作品に加え、立体作品なども展示予定。UltraSuperNew Galleryではこの個展のために描き下ろした新作のみを展示します。

title.en: TAKERU AMANO SOLO EXHIBITION – Primavera The Appearance of Venus –
title.jp: TAKERU AMANO SOLO EXHIBITION  – Primaveraビーナスの登場 –

intro.en: “ TAKERU AMANO SOLO EXHIBITION – Primavera The Appearance of Venus – ” will be on show at UltraSuperGallery in Harajuku, displaying portraits of Venus in the iconic bold lines and composition alongside the never before seen work “impression Primavera” featuring motifs of impressionist landscapes.
intro.jp: 原宿UltraSuperNew Galleryでは、「TAKERU AMANO SOLO EXHIBITION – Primaveraビーナスの登場-」と題した個展を4月6日から4月29日まで開催。大胆な線と構図がアイコニックなビーナスの人物画や、今までにない印象派の風景をモチーフにした新作「impression Primavera」と題した作品を展示します。

description.en: Highly acclaimed both in Japan and overseas, artist Takeru Amano studied woodblock printing in New York and is now based between Tokyo and Paris where he creates and exhibits his iconic works that combine cute and fleeting qualities packaged simply within clear colors. At this exhibition, he will be displaying 20 works created in 2021 including works resembling Impressionist landscapes that form a whole new genre of their own. Be sure to check out the works by Takeru Amano, who is rapidly gaining even more attention across the world, as he pays homage to traditional art through inspired ways.
description.jp: 国内外で高い評価を得ているアーティスト天野タケルは、ＮYで版画を学び、現在はパリと東京を拠点に作品を制作・発表しています。儚さと可愛さを持ち合わせ、明快な色彩に簡略化された線が特徴な人物画は、氏のアイコン的存在。その氏が新たなジャンルとして、2021年に制作された印象派の風景画を彷彿とさせる新作を含めた、計20点を発表します。伝統的な創造へのオマージュ、インスピレーションを得た作風で、国内外のアート関係者から注目されているアーティストの展示にぜひ足をお運びください。

intro.en: “IROPPOI [色っぽい] means sensual in Japanese. This word is for me pure poetry. Sensuality is the very breath of art, of life and of everything in between… and this is why this word resonates into my soul. The word “Iroppoi’’ itself resonates like a wonderful haiku. The title of an immortal song. It became the obvious choice to me for the name of this exhibition. Expressing visually “sensuality” is important for me as every woman embodies “iroppoi” in my opinion. Beauty lies in the eye of the beholder, but I believe sensuality should be obvious to anyone.
intro.jp:
色っぽい]は官能的(sensual)という意味で。私がその言葉から感じられ る 官 能 的 な 力 は ア ー ト や 人 生 の す べ て に 影 響 を 与 え る と 考 え ま し た 。 私はその言葉から感じられる官能的な力はアートや人生のすべてに

IROPPOIプロジェクトは、女性全般と、この展示会のためにコラボレーションした各モデルにインスパイアされた私の感情についての情熱的な証言です。時に挑発的で、時にロマンティックで、時にナイーブで、時にシンプルに幻想的。

description.en:
IROPPOI project is a passionate testimony about my emotions and my feelings inspired by women in general and each model I collaborated with for this exhibit. Sometimes provocative, sometimes romantic, sometimes naive, sometimes simply fantastic, the way to show Iroppoi’s models is simple and direct. Away from the “male gaze”, I let the focus and the angle of my images bare to allow the model to decide what she wants to reveal. This also means no digital alteration on the models has been performed. Iroppoi shows them by keeping a neutral point of view. It is a direct exchange, an intimate moment between the model and my camera, enhanced digitally by overlaying graphics, positive words and ideas, sometimes borrowed expressions or song titles.

My entire style is based on everlasting love for graffiti, an art form I discovered when I was 14 years old. I wanted to keep an “handwritten” look even if it was digital. So, I decided to use the “flop” style for its curves and voluptuousness that I felt fits the sensuality of the models.

Women are thinkers, fighters, mothers, sisters, workers… but to many, they are still considered inferior to men. It is an unfortunate truth and as an artist, I want to fight against this sexist vision. This is why I wanted every image to convey positive messages and ideas. All models are showing what they want and who they are. IROPPOI [色っぽい] means sensual but I hope that through this exhibition it will express even more. The celebration of the all-around fabulousness of women!”
description.jp:
「色っぽい」のモデルを見せる方法はシンプルで大胆なもの。男性の視線(ゲイズ)から離れて、モデル自身が何を表現したいかを決めることができるように、私のイメージの焦点と角度を出しています。モデルにデジタル加工を施すことなく、、中立的な視点を保つことで、彼女らを見せています。モデルと私のカメラとの直接のやりとりであり、親密な瞬間であり、グラフィックやポジティブな言葉やアイデア、時には借用した表現や曲のタイトルを重ね合わせることで、デジタル的に強化されています。

私のスタイルは、14歳の時に発見したグラフィティへの永遠の愛がベースであり、デジタルであっても「手書き感」を残したいと思っていました。なのでモデルの官能性に合うと感じた曲線とボリューミーさから、”フロップ “スタイルにしました。

女性は時に思想家であり、戦士であり、母親であり、姉妹であり、労働者である。しかし、多くの人にとって、女性は男性よりも劣っていると思われているのです。これは不幸な真実であり、アーティストとして、私はこの性差別的なビジョンと戦います。全ての女性が持つ、自分らしい[色っぽい]をアートを通して表現した展覧会をぜひ、お楽しみください。全ての女性に祝福を!」

intro.en: This exhibition is dedicated to the 6 months of peaceful protests in Belarus. Since the presidential elections in August 2020, numerous unprecedented events took place in Belarus, drawing the whole world’s eyes to Belarus and inspiring many Belarusian artists to create their art.
intro.jp: 「Expired. ベラルーシ発 抵抗のアート」は、ベラルーシでの6か月に及ぶ平和的な抗議活動に捧げられます。2020年8月の大統領選挙以降、ベラルーシでは前代未聞の出来事が数多く起こり、全世界の目がベラルーシに集まり、多くのベラルーシ人アーティストの創作意欲を刺激しました。

description.en:
This exhibition tells a story of those events through art, reflecting the peaceful nature of Belarusian resistance. It explores how local initiatives, citizen’s self-organization, women’s movement, and art have become the driving force against violence and police brutality in the battle to end “the last dictatorship of Europe”.

You will see a selection of posters by more than 40 artists. The special feature of this exhibition are the works of Iłla Jeraševič, a Belarusian artist living and working in Tokyo. He will present the works that were inspired by the revolution and became the main symbols of art resistance, as well as works that influenced the shape of his protest art.

Curators: Hanna Ulasava, Iłla Jeraševič
With the help of the Belarusian Community in Japan
description.jp:
本グループ展は、ベラルーシの抵抗運動の平和的な性質を反映したアートを通してこれらの出来事を物語ります。「ヨーロッパ最後の独裁政権」を終わらせるための闘いの中で、地域のイニシアチブや市民の自己組織化、女性の運動、そしてアートが、暴力や警察の残虐性に対抗する原動力となっていった様子を探ります。

40人以上のアーティストによるポスターのセレクションをご覧いただけます。本展の目玉は、東京在住のベラルーシ人アーティスト、イリヤ・イェラシェビッチの作品です。革命に触発され、芸術による抵抗運動の主要な象徴となった作品や、彼のプロテスト・アートの形に影響を与えた作品をご紹介します。

主催者：ウラサヴァ・ハンナ、イェラシェビッチ・イリヤ
協力：在日本ベラルーシ人の会

title.en: Art in the Time of Corona
title.jp: Art in the Time of Corona

intro.en:
“Art in the Time of Corona”, is a brand new collection of 26 paintings all created in Tokyo in 2020 by British artist, IAIN LONSDALE.

This collection expresses the inner tensions brought on by the unprecedented confinement this year and the will of the spirit to break free from physical restrictions.
intro.jp:
“Art in the Time of Corona” は、イギリス人アーティスト、IAIN LONSDALEが2020年に東京で制作した全26点のペインティングコレクションです。

このコレクションは、今年、誰もが経験した予想ができなかった監禁(ステイホーム)がもたらす内なる緊張感と、肉体的制約からの脱却を目指す精神の意志を表現しています。

description.en:
IAIN explores form, color and space on canvas in a spontaneous way, without a preconceived destination.

He uses acrylic paint and adhesives, his tools are brush, palette knife and chopstick.

“In 2020, I continue to explore ways to visually articulate my journey and continue to create spaces within boundaries. These images represent flights of the mind exploring new places”
description.jp:
IAINは絵の具と接着剤を使い、道具には筆、パレットナイフ、箸を使用し、先入観のない自然な方法を用い、キャンバスの上で形、色、空間を探し表現します。

2020年、私は自分の旅を視覚的に表現する方法を模索し続け、境界線の中に空間を作り続けています。そしてこれらのイメージは、新しい場所を探索する心の飛行を表現しています。

intro.en:
UltraSuperNewギャラリーはギャラリーをアトリエとして再利用するInstudioプログラムを続けており、次に参加するアーティストをご紹介します。Tercerosさん、ようこそ！
今回のInstudioではさらにパーソナルなコンテンツを企画中。みなさんとの会話やQ&Aを通してよりアーティストと交流できる機会を作りたいと思います。では、Instudioを楽しみにしてください！
intro.jp:
UltraSuperNewギャラリーはギャラリーをアトリエとして再利用するInstudioプログラムを続けており、次に参加するアーティストをご紹介します。Tercerosさん、ようこそ！
今回のInstudioではさらにパーソナルなコンテンツを企画中。みなさんとの会話やQ&Aを通してよりアーティストと交流できる機会を作りたいと思います。では、Instudioを楽しみにしてください！

intro.en: We’re keeping it creative from our gallery to you! UltraSuperNew Gallery is excited to present our very first installation of “IN STUDIO”, an entirely virtual glimpse into the creative process of a resident artist!⁠
intro.jp: ウルトラスーパーニューギャラリーでは、ギャラリーをアトリエに変身させる「IN STUDIO」シリーズを実施します！そこで制作する一人のアーティストのプロセスを全てネットで公開します。⁠

description.en:
It is our pleasure to introduce @Eirdis , an Icelandic & Chinese artist. Her paintings are brimming with spontaneity and present an instrumental use of color as metaphor for the coalescence of the mind with material: an organic bridge into the subconscious.⁠
⁠
Using USNG as her studio from today until April 20th, Eirdis will bring her world into the gallery’s space, and then straight to you! Tune in for this new and exciting chapter here at USNG!⁠

Follow her adventures on our instagram!
description.jp:
シリーズ初のアーティストEirdisは、アイスランドと中国のアーティスト。彼女の絵画は自発性にあふれ、色彩を道具に物質と心の融合を表しています。彼女の作品を見ていると自身の潜在意識へどんどん近づいていくような気な・・・⁠
⁠
本日から4月20日の２週間、ウルトラスーパーニューギャラリーはEirdisのスタジオとして利用されて彼女の世界をギャラリーのスペースから皆さまへ発信します。ぜひ楽しみにしてください！⁠

Follow her adventures on our instagram!

intro.en:
UltraSuperNew Gallery is proud to present ‘Cloud 9’, a solo exhibition by mySERENA.

mySERENA is not shy of using masses of color, form and texture to communicate a sense of ‘flow’ in her work. The artist incorporates ideas from her multidisciplinary studies and the techniques she learned during her wide-ranging travels around the world, and uses metaphorical images created with acrylic, pastel, ink, gold leaf, employing both Western and Asian painting techniques. Her paintings feature abstract landscapes with colorful yet meticulous details that absorb the viewer into her world. She is also influenced with iki, a chic yet simple Japanese aesthetic that incorporates the more famous term wabi sabi. Now, she handles her artworks with a more disciplined approach.
intro.jp: mySERENAは香港出身、香港市役所という文化的ランドマークで個展 「Be in Clovers」 にて史上最年少の女性アーティストとして国際的な注目を集めているアーティストです。日本の文化と伝統からインスピレーションを得るために頻繁に日本を訪問し続けている彼女は個展「クラウドナイン」の世界ツアーの幕開けを東京で催することになりました。

description.en: Throughout her life, the artist is deeply inspired by nature, and how it affects us as humans. She is particularly fascinated by the moon. It is scientifically proven that the moon affects the oceans and tides, but to what extent does it influence human behaviour? This is a topic that interests the artist endlessly and is also a recurring theme in Chinese folktales. For this reason, mySERENA enjoys depicting landscapes and the moon in her paintings the most. The installation, “Renewal”, of two large suspended burnt golden canvases are the “elevated” illustrations of her new “Alchemy” series. Her innovative use of fire, a symbol of both death and life, is a direct challenge to the classical treatment of a painting surface – a bold alteration that gives new identity to the traditional medium, intending to provoke the audience to think about how they look at transformative events in life.
description.jp:
mySERENAの作品は、色、形、質感に重心を置きながらそれらを結びつける 「フロー（流れ）」 が特徴的です。テクニカルな面では世界各地を巡り手にした技法を取り入れ、アクリル、パステル、インク、そして金箔まで西洋とアジアの絵画技法を組み合わせた比喩的なイメージを実現しています。さらに描かれている抽象的な風景には豊かな色彩とディテールが刻まれています。日本の美学 「いき」 にも影響を受けている近代の作品にはより規律のあるアプローチで作品を手掛けている思考も観察できます。

mySERENAは自然からの人間への影響に興味を持っています。その中でも彼女は「月」というモチーフに大きなテーマをおいています。「月」はmySERENAの作品に次々と現れるテーマであり、同時に中国の民話にも良く登場するテーマでもあります。月が海洋や潮汐に影響を与えることは科学的に証明されていますが、一体人間の行動にはどれほどの影響があるのでしょうか。また、「クラウドナイン」では球体の彫刻作品も初に発表されます。

本展示で発表された空中に釣らされているインスタレーション「Renewal」は燃やされている金色のキャンバスになり「Alchemy」シリーズの新作です。

燃やすという新しいテクニックを使用し、生と死をテーマにする彼女はペインティングの新たな境地を探っているように見れます。このようにキャンバスという古き素材に新たな手法を使うことで、作品を目にする人は自身の成長を振り返るきっかけになると祈っています。

mySERENAの神秘的な世界に足を踏み入れてみませんか。ぜひオープニング・リセプションにご参加くださいませ。

intro.en:
“House 2020” features 7 graduates from the Printmaking department of Musashino Art University.

In the world of “House 2020” viewers will be confronted not just with print-based artworks on the walls, but also a look into the process of making them, with reoccurring live painting events throughout the exhibition. You will also be able to buy the artists’ hand made prints, stickers, tote bags, iPhone cases, and key chains.

Step in, to the world created by emerging artists!
intro.jp:
武蔵野美術大学版画専攻を卒業した同期7名の展示「House 2020」をUltraSuperNewにて開催いたします。

「House 2020」では版画作品をメインとした展示に及、普段ではアトリエでしか目にできない作家各自の制作過程を公開するライブペインティングを日々披露することにより「アットホーム」な展示に挑みます。グッズ販売も多数、原画、ステッカー、トートバッグ、iPhoneケース、キーホルダーなど手作りグッズが購入できます。

若手作家たちが作り出す世界へ、お邪魔します！

intro.en: The more social you are, the more likely you are to “Experience” your boundaries every day. We, who live in a cycle of being connected and separated, have each and every story.
intro.jp:
人と人が出会う。見つめ合う。触れ合う。
さて、そこのリアリティはどこにあるのだろうか。
客観的にその一連を見る、私だろうか。それとも、お互いの風景に相手の体が収まって、近づくと顔がぼやけて、果てには触れると伝わる外部の妙な暖かさか。あるいはリアリティとは、だれかにハグをするとお互いが見えなくなり、後ろの風景が見える、その光景のことを言うのだろうか。

description.en:
Fukuda Momoko is an artist who seems to be describing the story.

When I see her work, I feel the warmth of the human touch, and at the same time also feel a tingling pain. Because what is depicted in it is an act of your body that you do not always look at, and at the same time you cannot help feeling uneasy about the extraordinary wonders of the human connection. It feels like you’re facing the boundaries between people, the realities that exist under their bodies.
description.jp:
人は社交的な生き物であるほど、このようにお互いの境界線を毎日「体験」しているはず。繋がって、離れる、その繰り返しの中に生きる私たちには一つひとつのストーリーがある。

福田桃子はまるでその物語を描いているような作家である。
彼女の作品を目にすると、人肌の接触の暖かさを感じると共に、なぜかピリッと苦しくなる。そこに描かれているものは、いつも目を向けていない自身の身体の行為、と同時にそこにある非日常な不思議さに不安を抱くことを避けられないからだ。しかしそれは、まるで自分の「体験」を客観的ではなく個人的な視線に置き換えた風景のよう。人と人の境界線、それらの体の元に存在するリアリティと向き合うような感覚になる。

intro.en: UltraSuperNew Gallery presents the immersive duo exhibition UZU, featuring paintings by Italian artist Sante Visioni and plants installations by Japanese artist Mitsurin Tokyo. This is the first time the artists will be collaborating on a joint exhibition. The exhibition will take place from January 26th until February 2nd, 2020 at UltraSuperNew Gallery in Tokyo.
intro.jp: UltraSuperNew Gallery」 は、イタリアの画家サンテ・ヴィジオーニの絵画と、フラワーアーティスト密林東京 によるインスタレーションの2人展「UZU」 を開催します。2人が展覧会を開くのは今回が初となります。展覧会は1月26日から年2月2日まで、原宿にあるUltraSuperNew Galleryで開催されます。

description.en:
UZU, can be defined as a “swirl” in Japanese. In this exhibition, the swirl becomes a circle; a circle of life, as life in humans and nature runs along the cyclic path death and rebirth. The unconventional duo created a parallel between the evolution of life of both mankind and plants, highlighting the transience of human life and, by doing so, glorifying every single moment of it. The artists achieved this by combining visual art and physical installations in a unique mix that puts the spectator at the centre, inviting them to reflect on and accept their destiny, and share what they learned with the generations to come. This is what keeps this virtual circle in perpetual movement.

Sante Visioni will showcase 6 paintings, which represent the result of his research on what men can learn from the plants’ world throughout their life. Mitsurin Tokyo will present a complex installation revolving around the evolution between different lifetime periods and embracing the paintings. By bringing both artists’ works together, the parallelism and rhythmic flow in both worlds become apparent.

The exhibition is the very first attempt of the artists to combine such different techniques and backgrounds, distinguishing the exhibition as a cutting edge experiment in the Tokyo art scene.

Discover this evolution with us at UltraSuperNew Gallery Opening Reception from Sunday, the 26th of January at 6:30PM.
description.jp:
「UZU」は日本語の「渦」から由来して、人間と自然が生命と死を巡る果てしないサイクルを表しています。偶然巡り合った２人は、人間と植物、両方の生命について共通点を探り、人間の生命のはかなさを強調することと同時にそこにある美を手がかりに、制作に挑みました。アーティストたちは絵画とインスタレーションを混ざり合わせる中、観客を中心に据えたユニークなインスタレーションを作り出しました。

サンテ・ヴィジオーニは、人間が一生を通じて植物の世界から学べることを表現した6点の作品を展示。密林東京 は、円環する生命をイメージした、インスタレーションを発表。両アーティストの作品のパラレルとリズミカルなテンポが見どころです。

異なる技術と背景を組み合わせた展覧会が、東京のアートシーンにおける最先端の実験として注目されることを願っております。

1月26日（日）午後18:30から開催されるオープニングレセプションにも是非、お越しくださいませ。

intro.en:
UltraSuperNew Gallery in Tokyo and Singapore are proud to present their first inter-gallery collaborative exhibition, Hello /enter.

In effort to aid local artists in building networks outside of the country, UltraSuperNew Gallery has initiated the programme Hello /enter. This programme sees us further leveraging on the relationship of our two sister galleries in Tokyo and Singapore. It enables gallery coordinators to help connect local artists with each other across countries – a feat that would have been left up to chance. In the eight-week programme, artists will only be given public, digital information of each other (e.g. online portfolios, email addresses) and will have to reach out to each other through the Internet. At the end of the programme, artists will have to create at least one work in collaboration with each other and individual documentation of the entire programme. These will be showcased in both galleries during the exhibition that opens on 9th January 2020 and runs till 16th January 2020.
intro.jp:
東京とシンガポールに姉妹ギャラリーを持つUltraSuperNew Galleryは展示会「Hello /enter」を国境を超えた二つの会場で同時開催いたします。

若手アーティストが国外でのネットワークを構築することを支援するため、UltraSuperNew Galleryは「Hello/enter」というプログラムを開始しました。プログラムでは、東京とシンガポールにある2つの姉妹ギャラリーの関係を活用することによって、国境を越えるアーティスト同士を結びつける役割を果たしています。８週間のプログラムはシンガポールのアーティスト、日本人のアーティストの２人はデジタル情報(例:オンラインポートフォリオ、メールアドレス)を渡し合うことによって始まります。インターネットを通じた関係のみで、アーティスト達は1つの作品制作をコラボすることに挑みます。さらに、プログラム中の個々のドキュメントを作成したタイムラインも作品と共に展示されます。2020年1月9日から2020年1月16日までの会期中に東京、そしてシンガポールのギャラリーで展示され、初の試みとして作家だけでなく、ギャラリー同士のコラボレーションを通してでしかできない、極めて新しい試みに挑戦します。

description.en: The first of its kind, the exhibition is an experimentation on collaboration of not only by the artists but also the galleries as well. This iteration of Hello /enter finds the artists exploring connections and connectivity through digital, physical and emotional distance. In combining both their practice, they utilise both site-installations and video installations in this exhibition. Taking their island countries as departure, the artists form and inform their works through what stands between them: the sky and the sea.
description.jp: プログラムのタイトル、「Hello/enter」　はアーティスト同士がデジタル状のやりとりに制限された時に最も避けられない、デジタルと物理の関係やフィジカルとエモーショナルな距離をテーマにし、表現しています。今回の展示会では現地のインスタレーションとビデオインスタレーションを使用し、さらに島国を出発点として、空と海をモチーフにする作品が見られます。

intro.en:
Whenever I entered Nao’s studio, I found myself gulping down my excitement. There, you find giant stacks of canvas, colorful paint tubes all over the floor, and her back, as always, facing the canvas.

Nao’s oil paintings shock the viewer with its colorful use of pigments and liveliness. At the same time, one can not escape asking themselves, “who is the one drawn on the canvas?”. Because as one looks closer at the human figure, one notices with it its traces of vicious energy. To me it is almost like a person’s life force splashed on a canvas.
intro.jp:
片岡のアトリエに入るたびに、息を飲むほど感動している自分がいた。そこには散らばる大きいキャンバス、多数の絵の具チューブ、そしてキャンバスと本気で向き合う彼女の後ろ姿があった。

彼女の作品を見ると、その作品の色彩、エネルギーに圧倒されるであろう。それと同時に、一体この人は誰なのだろうかという疑問が頭をよぎるだろう。何故ならば、キャンバスに浮き上がってくる人物には凄まじいほどのエネルギーの痕跡が残っているからだ。それはまるで、命をキャンバスにぶつけているように見えた。

intro.en: UltraSuperNew Gallery presents, in collaboration with Chromatic and MASSIVart, FRAMED and MUTEK.JP, a 100% screen-based duo exhibition featuring a series of recent videos by Canadian artist Sabrina Ratté and Japanese artist Yoshi Sodeoka. The exhibition will take place from December 1 to 12, 2019 at UltraSuperNew Gallery in Tokyo.
intro.jp: ChromaticとMASSIVart主催、UltraSuperNew Gallery、FRAMED、MUTEK.JPの３社の協力の元、カナダのアーティスト、Sabrina Rattéと日本のアーティスト、Yoshi Sodeokaの新作であるビデオ作品シリーズがフィーチャーされる、100%スクリーン・ベースの二人展が開催されます。この展覧会は、東京のUltraSuperNew Galleryにて2019年12月1日から19日まで開催される予定です。

description.en:
Supported by a hybrid creative process that is both analog and digital, Ratté and Sodeoka deploy an unconventional artistic approach that challenges the video medium. While questioning the major issues of visual media, its perception and the interpretation of the world in the digital age, they have distinguished themselves by generating tantalizing narrative universes with singularly ultra-guided aesthetics.

Sabrina Ratté will present some of the 3D environments resulting from her research on spatiality and the sensory and psychological experience that architecture provides. As for Yoshi Sodeoka, he will showcase a series of abstract video animations whose organic forms and blatant colors open a portal to a psychedelic and illusory world far from reality.

Although they have already collaborated on various projects and participated in multiple group exhibitions, this will be the first time that their work will be brought together in a gallery for a duo exhibition.

Credits
Concept : Chromatic
Curators : Arthur Gaillard, Benoit Palop
Production : Claire Tousignant / MASSIVart
description.jp:
RattéとSodeokaは、アナログとデジタルを混成させた制作を通し、ビデオ表現そのものを挑戦する独創的でアーティスティックなアプローチを展開します。ビジュアル・メディアの主な課題やデジタル時代における知覚と解釈を問いかけながら作り上げられる彼らのコンセプトと特徴的な美意識は他にはない魅力を持っています。

Sabrina Rattéは建築が用いる空間的、知覚的、そして精神的な感覚についてのリサーチから生みだされた３D環境を発表します。Yoshi Sodeokaは、有機的形態と激しい色彩を通してサイケデリックで幻影な世界を思いうかばせる抽象的なビデオ・アニメーションのシリーズを発表します。

過去に彼らは既に多数のプロジェクトでコラボレーションを果たし、グループ展にも参加しましたが、二人の作品が二人展のためにギャラリーにて発表されるのは今回初めてとなります。

協力

コンセプト：Chromatic

キュレイター：Arthur Gaillard, Benoit Palop

制作：Claire Tousignant / MASSIVart

intro.en:
From November 22nd, UltraSuperNew Gallery will proudly present “Vanishing Sights,” a solo exhibition by João de Mendonça Lima Neto.

During his travels, Mendonça had the opportunity to go where nature is still unspoilt and went on to develop his signature aesthetic photography style. In some cases, he ventured to places unknown; in others, to places already taken over by spurious ‘civilization’. Nature, being one of the oldest subjects in photography, is nevertheless still relevant today. Nature and landscape photographers appeared on the art scene in the latter half of the 19th century, and made it their intention to provide an authentic portrayal of reality, yet still trying to mimic nature depictions in paintings. These days, as a result of modern day technology, the accessibility of nature photography has drastically increased. Nature photography serves as a way to remind us of the allure of the outside world and that it is something we must all deem as valuable.
intro.jp:
11月22日より、UltraSuperNew GalleryはJoão de Mendonça Lima Netoによる個展「Vanishing Sights (消えゆく景色)」を開催します。

旅をする中Mendonçaは手付かずの大自然に出会う機会を得、彼の特徴である美しい写真表現を追求してきました。彼が未開拓だと思って行った場所では、偽の 「文明」 にすでに乗っ取られていたりといったこともありました。

description.en:
The photographs presented in this exhibition are an ode to nature’s beauty. Beauty as the universal aesthetic judgement that leads to the photographs themselves. In other words, the photographs are not a product of an accidental moment. The act of photographing is just the beginning, a first movement; the second comes from using different applications to find a balance that matches an aesthetic view. The photographs are about vanishing sights of places and peoples.

Mendonça will introduce a series of black and white photographs; focusing on transient landscapes and faces he has encountered during his travels throughout Asia. Explore his story with us at UltraSuperNew Gallery in Harajuku from Friday the 22nd of November, 7:00pm to 9:30pm.
description.jp:
写真において最も古いテーマの一つである自然は、今日でも重要な被写体です。19世紀後半には自然写真や風景写真が登場し、真のリアリティの追求を意図してきましたが、それは絵画における自然描写の模倣に過ぎませんでした。現代の技術の結果として自然写真のアクセシビリティは劇的に増加しました。自然写真は、外の世界の魅力を思い起こさせてくれるものであり、そのことに価値をみんなが感じるべきものです。

この個展に展示される写真は、自然の美しさを表しています。その美は、写真そのものの表現にもつながる普遍的に美しいとされる美です。写真は偶然の産物ではありません。写真を撮るという行為は始まりにすぎず、さまざまなアプリケーションを使用して、アーティストの美的観点に合致するバランスを見つける表現方法です。そして写真は、消えて行く場所や人々の姿を切り取っていきます。

本個展ではずっとそこにはない景色、アジアを旅行中に出会った人たちを撮した一連のモノクロ写真を紹介します。原宿のUltraSuperNew Gallery で、11/22 (金) 夜7時から9時半まで彼が経験したストーリーを垣間見にきてください。

intro.en: UltraSuperNew Gallery is proud to present the collaborative mixed media exhibition “GO (5)” from November 1st until November 8th, with an opening reception on Friday, November 1st from 7PM.
intro.jp: UltraSuperNew Galleryは、11月1日から11月8日まで、合同ミクストメディア展「GO (5)」を開催し、11月1日金曜日19時からオープニングレセプションを行います。

description.en:
Project 72 STEPS

72 STEPS is a collaborative project between two Russian-born Tokyo-based artists, photographer Yulia Skogoreva and designer Olga Gerasim. Sharing a combined 15 years experience of living in Japan the duo’s core artistic practice is rooted in appreciation of Japanese traditions and seasonality. Nature inspired rituals and customs still keep the strong spirit of Japanese identity alive. Even more so, traditions are key for small towns struggling to keep up with urbanisation and population decline. 72 STEPS pays homage to the concept of Japan’s 72 micro seasons with a series of exhibitions highlighting the country’s rural areas through the prism of visual art and dance. The origins of the 72 seasons concept can be found in the ancient 24 season calendar. The 24 divisions were split into three more, to create a more precise 72 season calendar reflecting the uniqueness of nature. Lasting just five days or so, each season shares a special name carefully depicting the tiny, delicate changes in nature that constantly occur around us.

GO (5)

Go (stands for number 5 in Japanese) is the first exhibition of the 72 STEPS project . It is inspired by the tradition of Tango-no-sekku (one of the five ceremonies Gosekku that were held at the Japanese imperial court) celebrated as Children’s Day in modern Japan and ornated with koi fish wind cones – Koinobori. To create this multidisciplinary work which includes photography, drawings, graphic design and performance, Yulia and Olga collaborated with an award-winning Japanese dancer and choreographer Miwa Okuno. Her practice attempts to disassemble the body in order to become free. In Go, Miwa sourced her inspiration in the traditional Japanese butoh dance practices allowing her to visibly float in the sky together with the Koinobori. The exhibition will highlight the collaboration between the three artists through an immersive experience where visitors will be invited to participate and activate installations. Rediscover the fineness and splendor of Japan’s seasons through immersive and participatory performances created by three talented artists.
description.jp:
プロジェクト「72 STEPS」

72 STEPSは東京をベースにする2人のロシア人アーティスト、写真家のYulia Skogorevaと、デザイナーOlga Gerasimの共同プロジェクトです。計15年にわたる日本での滞在の中で生まれた、日本の伝統や四季に感謝する気持ちが芸術活動のルーツ。自然由来の儀式や習慣は、日本人の精神性やアイデンティティーとして今も生き続けています。さらに伝統は、都市化と人口減少に悩まされる小さな街にとって重要な切り札。72 STEPSというプロジェクトは、日本に72パターン存在するの「ミクロ・シーズン」というコンセプトに敬意を表し、ビジュアル・アートとダンスという表現を通して日本の伝統をハイライトする展覧会を開催しています。72 STEPSは、日本に古くから伝わる「二十四節気（にじゅうしせっき）」にルーツを持ち、24の季節をさらに3つの季節に分け、自然の独自性を反映したより細やかな暦のこと。私たちの周りで常に起きている自然の小さな変化を丁寧に表現した特別な名前が、それぞれの季節わずか5日の間に名付けられています。

「GO (5)」とは？

72 STEPSプロジェクト初の展覧会「GO (5)」。こいのぼりを飾り「こどもの日」として祝われている、丹後の節句 (日本の朝廷で行われた五節句の一つ) にインスパイアされたプロジェクト。YuliaとOlgaは、写真、絵画、グラフィックデザイン、パフォーマンスなどの表現の枠を超えた作品を制作するために、受賞歴のある日本人ダンサーで振付師の奥野美和とコラボレーションを行います。奥野は「自由になる為の解体された身体」をテーマに国内外にて活動するダンサー。「GO (5)」では、日本の伝統的な舞踊からインスピレーションを得、こいのぼりと共に空を泳ぐようなダンスパフォーマンスを見せてくれます。

3人の才能溢れるアーティストがコラボレーションして作り出す、没入型かつ参加型のパフォーマンスを通し、日本の四季の細やかさ、素晴らしさを再発見してください。

intro.en:
UltraSuperNew Gallery in Harajuku presents “Back to Square One,” an artist group show eyeing the right and wrong angles of the perfect parallelogram.

Every year, the gallery challenges artists to ponder an incredibly vague, yet oddly specific subject, and from Friday, October 25th until October 31st, it’s the square.
intro.jp: UltraSuperNew Galleryは、USNにまつわるアーティスト達がある「お題」に沿って作品を制作・展示する「Back to Square One (振り出しに戻る)」を10月25日より開催します。

description.en:
This exhibition features 12 artists who will consider the square’s many definitions, and what resonates with them the most.

The square is a shape commonly known to be plain with four equal straight sides and four right angles, but nothing about the concept is so ordinary. The USN artists thought outside the box – literally, experimenting with various mediums, such as delicate paintings, surrealist illustrations, architectural designs, and unconventional digital creations.

From October 25th through October 31st, it’s hip to be square at UltraSuperNew Gallery. Join us during the week or come to the “Back to Square One” opening night reception on October 25th from 19:00.

Participating artists:

Archibald Blondinet, Hanna Brieven, Julien Henrotte, Naomi Hirano, Jin Itomi, Ozy Kozy, Leonard Le, Tatsuo Morikawa, Cheryl Mui, Kelly Nguyen, Malo Yamakado and Gabriela Zumbado
description.jp:
この展示会は12人のアーティストが参加。毎年恒例である本展示、今年のテーマは「正方形」。参加アーティストは正方形の定義を多角的な方向から捉え、様々な表現方法で見せてくれます。

正方形とは、4つの辺の長さが全て等しく、4つの角の角度が全て等しい平面図形であることが一般的に知られていますが、その概念についてはそれほど一般的ではありません。その曖昧な概念を、繊細な絵画、超リアルなイラスト、建築デザイン、斬新なデジタル作品など、既成概念に囚われずに、さまざまなメディアを通して自由に表現します。

展示は、10月25日から10月31日までの間UltraSuperNew Galleryで開催。アーティストも在廊する10月25日19時からのオープニングレセプションに、ぜひ立ち寄りください。

参加アーティスト:

Archibald Blondinet, Hanna Brieven, Julien Henrotte, Naomi Hirano, Jin Itomi, Ozy Kozy, Leonard Le, Tatsuo Morikawa, Cheryl Mui, Kelly Nguyen, Malo Yamakado, Gabriela Zumbado

title.en: In the Bat of an Eye

intro.en: UltraSuperNew Gallery in Harajuku is thrilled to introduce the solo show In the Bat of an Eye by Japanese photographer Ayaka Horiuchi.
intro.jp: 原宿のUltraSuperNew Galleryでは、写真家・堀内彩香「まばたきの数えかた」の展示を9/6から開催いたします。

description.en:
“A picture is taken as I peek through the viewfinder with one eye.

I hit the shutter button.

In that instant, light hits and burns an image onto the film.

In the small window of time that occurs when I hit the shutter, I lose sight of what I’m about to capture.

All that exists in that moment is blackness.
In preparing for this show, I am finally catching a glimpse of the many moments I could not see.

I wonder, was I really there at that moment?”

By using film photography, Horiuchi ponders on the photographers’ role and vision in the action of capturing an image. The instant a photo is taken, the final image will differ from what the photographer initially wished to record. The outcome represents that one second that the photographer could not see. To what extent was it the photographer’s decision to capture that fleeting moment?

In this solo-exhibition, Horiuchi will display a photo series shot entirely on film that focuses on everyday life simplicities, moments that vanish in the bat of an eye. Let’s continue the conversation on and join us for the opening reception on the 6th of September from 7PM.
description.jp:
「写真を撮る。
ファインダーを片目で覗く。
シャッターを押す。その一瞬の光が、フィルムに焼きつく。

考えてみると、シャッターを切る0.数秒の間、
わたしはその景色を見てないのだ。
シャッター幕の黒い瞬間だけが通り過ぎる。

その写真を並べることは、
自分が見ることの出来なかった沢山の瞬間と対峙することになるのだ。

わたしはその瞬間、本当にそこに存在したのだろうか？」

作家は、フィルム写真を通して画像を撮る行動におけるカメラマンの存在理由とビジョンについて考察します。最終的に撮影された写真は、最初に記録しようとしたものとは異なり、そこに写ったものは写真家が実際の目で見ることができなかった数秒間。その瞬間を撮影するという写真家の想いはどんなものでしょう。

この個展では、まばたきの中で消えてしまう、ありふれた毎日をテーマに全編フィルムを使って撮影された写真シリーズを展示します。9月6日午後7時からのオープニングレセプションにぜひお立ち寄りください。

intro.en:
From the 24th of August, UltraSuperNew Gallery in Harajuku is thrilled to present the collaborative exhibition “Zuko5 Exhibition” by none other than Zuko5.

“Before you ever realize it, you stop. You forget. You acclimate. You leave passion and curiosity behind with age.”
intro.jp:
UltraSuperNew Galleryは8月24日から「ズコウ５」によるコラボ展示「Zuko5 Exhibition」を開催します。

「いつの間にかやらなくなること、忘れてしまうこと、慣れてしまうこと。年齢と一緒にどこかへ置いてしまいがちになる熱さや好奇心。」

description.en:
Since 2012, this group has been intentionally trying to keep this passion and curiosity ー something that used to seem so natural before ー from slipping out of their hands. As a team, they come up with ideas to stimulate their abilities and provoke new works.

“Even now, we are doing our best to keep that same energy, similar to the times we sat dazed in the classroom.”

As we all grow older and some of us wiser, our creativity has the tendency to slowly evaporate. It is up to us to deliberately keep this from happening. We must work hard, and play even harder; the motto Zuko5 lives by. They know no limits in their photography, as they often break the fourth wall, and are not shy to use body paint and lightsabers.

Come and join us as we explore Zuko5’s comical approach to keeping their passion alive and discover what it means to become an adult. The Opening Reception will be held at UltraSuperNew Gallery from Saturday, August 24th at 6:00PM.
description.jp:
2012年に結成した撮影チーム。昔は当たり前だった情熱や好奇心が消えてなくならないように、メンバーがアイデアを出しそれぞれの能力を刺激しあい、新しい作品に挑戦する。

「あの頃、教室で夢中だった気持ちを今もそのままに。」

一般的に人が年をとり賢くなるにつれて、創作欲は徐々に消えていく傾向があります。それを避けるために、彼らは「仕事も遊びも本気」をモットーにしています。写真表現に限界はないと信じていて、現実と虚構の壁を破り、ボディーペイントやライトセーバーを使うことにも、ためらいはありません。情熱を生かし続けるズコウ５のコミカルなアプローチを通し、「大人になるとは何か？」その意味を考えにきてください。オープニングレセプションは8月24日(土)午後6時から午後9まで、当ギャラリーで開催。 ぜひ、お越しください！

intro.en:
“We Cool?”: an expression used often amongst friends to see if the relationship is healthy, mutually beneficial, or simply still in existence.

In today’s day and age, modern technology has helped keep us connected but has it brought us closer together?
intro.jp: Paul Wigが世界中のアーティストを集めて一緒に集まります。 原宿、日本質問をするのは「私たちはクール?」です。UltraSuperNewギャラリー、8月16日- 21日、 2019。「私たちはクール?」:関係が健康的であるか、相互に有益であるか、あるいは単にまだ存在してい るかを見るために友人の間でしばしば使われる表現。

description.en:
This Summer, in the Harajuku district of Tokyo, UltraSuperNew Gallery is hosting artists from around the world who have responded to the question proposed by Paul Wig, “We Cool?”.

This group, collaborative show is the collective response in mixed media forms. From oil paint to nail art and fine jewelry, the eclecticness of the art speaks to the diversity that can exist in the ecosystems of friendships.

International artist include:
@willnichols @nana_uchida @james3vans @cabbage.lovl @donald_death @dannymaker @atlasfoto @oylmiller @gymstandard @swishprojects @arena_embrodoidery and @chriscadaver
description.jp:
今日の時代において、現代のテクノロジーは私たちをつなぎとめておくのに役立ちましたが、それは私たち をより緊密にしましたか?今年の夏、東京の原宿地区で、UltraSuperNew Galleryは、Paul Wigが提 案した「We Cool?」という質問に答えた世界中のアーティストをホストしています。

このグループ、共同ショーは混合メディア形式での集合的な反応です。油絵の具からネイルアート、ファイ ンジュエリーまで、アートの折衷性は友情の生態系に存在する可能性のある多様性に語ります。 国際的なアーティストが含まれます:
@willnichols @nana_uchida @ james3vans @ cabbage.lovl @donald_death @dannymaker @atlasfoto @oilmiller @gymstandard @swishprojects @arena_embrodoideryおよび@chri- scadaver

title.en: Looking for Map of Magic Place
title.jp: Looking for Map of Magic Place

intro.en: “Loneliness truly fascinates me. How can you not be alone, and still feel alone, or be alone and not feel alone? The physical state can be so different from the emotional state. What is the truth in a situation like this, and does it even matter if there isn’t one?”
intro.jp: 「孤独というものは、人を魅了します。なぜ一人でいるわけではないのに、孤独を感じるのか。また一人でいるのに、孤独と感じないのはなぜか。人生において物理的な状態と感情的な状態とに、大きくズレが生じることがあります。そのような状況で正しいものは何か？真実が見つからない場合、そのこと自体に問題は、あるのでしょうか？」

description.en:
From July 19 until July 26, Amsterdam based artist and designer, Bas Kosters will take over UltraSuperNew Gallery and show his creations about the multifaceted characteristics of loneliness. For his solo exhibition, ‘Looking for Map of Magic Place’, the artist investigates in depth how it feels to be alone in in a large capitol and work by himself for two months on a subject that is omnipresent in the big city life.

The exhibition consists of mixed media. Bas works with gouache and Japanese ink on paper, a medium that he’s exploring for the first time. The works are text-driven, with short yet graphic one-liners about all the different facets of longing for emotional and physical contact. In a bold aesthetic and almost advertising manner, Bas articulates the emotions of missing, caring and loneliness. Furthermore, there will also be textile pieces. Bas Kosters is a trained fashion designer and has cultivated a love for using textile in his art.

“From a very personal point of view lead by intimate fascinations and emotions, yet still looking towards the outside world, I try to capture the different meanings of loneliness. There is a certain beauty in being isolated, in being in solitude: gentleness and modesty. I also see this is present in the Japanese culture.”
description.jp:
7月19日（金）から7月26日（金）までUltraSuperNew Galleryにて、アムステルダムを拠点とするアーティスト/デザイナー、Bas Kostersが作品を展示します。

この個展“Looking for Map of Magic Place”では、作品の軸になる「孤独」を多面的に捉え表現に落とし込みました。どの大都会でも直面する「孤独」の問題に、制作期間の2ヶ月間自ら取り組み、どのように感じたのかを綿密に深掘りしていきます。

展示はミクストメディアで構成されています。特筆すべきは、ガッシュと墨汁を使用していることです。作品は文章からインスピレーションを受けて、感情および肉体的な接触を求める色々な局面を端的に表現した作品です。迷い、思いやり、そして孤独の感情を大胆に美しく、表現します。

さらに、テキスタイルを使った作品もあります。 Basはトレーニングを受けたファッションデザイナーであり、彼は自らの作品にテキスタイルを使うことに対して、愛情を育んできました。

「親密さと感情という非常に個人的なフィルターを通し、自分の外の世界を描くことで『孤独』の中に異なる意味を捉えようとしました。孤独の中には、『思いやり』と『謙虚さ』という凛とした美しさがあると思います。これは日本の文化の中にも見られることです」

intro.en:
UltraSuperNew Gallery is honored to present ‘Plastic Party’ a solo exhibition by Yeka Haski.

While on a surfing trip, Yeka experienced swimming in a sea of litter on the beaches of Bali. Inspired by this episode, Yeka has strived to find ways to talk about the topic of waste. In this solo exhibition, Yeka integrates her whimsical characters on discarded materials like plastic bags and objects creating art pieces that explore creativity in new forms. In repurposing materials, she instills a renewed significance into “trash” and in doing so, stirs a conversation about how we consume and produce waste today. Yeka will display small to large scaled paintings, one of which features ’blue sheets,’ a plastic mat commonly used during picnics in Japan. In painting on the ‘blue sheets,’ she transforms a generic material, often turning into quick waste into a work of art. Utilizing the allure of her art, she encourages her audience to have conversations about the environment and how we can start living “cleanly”.

Come and join us as we explore Haski’s playful approach to conscious-living. The Opening Reception will be held at the UltraSuperNew Gallery in Harajuku from Thursday, June 21st from 7:00pm – 9:30pm.
intro.jp:
UltraSuperNew GalleryはYeka Haskiによる個展「Plastic Party」を開催します。

サーフィン旅行中、ゴミだらけのバリの海で泳ぐ経験からインスピレーションを得、「ゴミ」について人々と会話する方法を模索するようになりました。この個展に向け彼女は、ビニール袋のような廃棄物と、彼女の遊びゴゴロあるキャラクターを組み合わせ新しい作品を制作。「ゴミ」に新しい意味を与えることで、私たちがどのようにモノを消費し、ゴミを作り出すかについて考えるきっかけを与えてくれます。今回展示する絵は小さいものから大きいものまで多岐にわたり、その中の一つにピクニックをするときにしか使われない、そのため使い捨てになりやすいアイテムである「ブルーシート」を利用した作品もあります。彼女の魅力的な作品をきっかけに環境について、そして“エコ”に生きるにはどうしたらいいかを考え、それを周りの人とも共有していただければ幸いです。

Yekaの興味深いアプローチを通して、普段の「当たり前」にちょっと意識を向けてみませんか？オープニングレセプションは、6月21日（木）午後7時から午後9時30分まで当ギャラリーで開催。 ぜひ、お越しください！

intro.en:
The motifs used this time around, flowers and people,
Are subjects that cannot be controlled
Allowing us to feel beauty in all that changes

The subject will change, just as I will change
Though the photograph may only portray the subject,
But within the picture lies my biases along with the viewer’s surroundings and emotions

In that moment, the image expands outside of my own hands
Potentially evolving the story so that it fits the viewer
The possibilities in between and the uncertainty photography provides
May just be the reason why I take photographs
intro.jp:
今回モチーフとなった、花も人も、
コントロールすることの出来ない
変化していく美しさを感じさせてくれる対象だと思う

被写体は変化していくし、僕自身も変化していく
写真には被写体のみが写るが、
そこには僕自身や写真を見る人の環境や感情も投影され写る

その時、写したコトは僕の手を離れて
誰かの物語になる可能性がある
写真がもつ余白と不確定さが好きだ
それが僕が写真を撮る理由の一つかもしれない

intro.en: UltraSuperNew Gallery is proud to present the solo show of the international painter Olga Alexopoulou. The exhibition, brought to you in global collaboration with Istanbul Concept Gallery and the Herakleidon Art Museum, reveals the artist’s evolution through the colour blue, an evolution that includes the intersection between art and advanced technology.
intro.jp: 世界で活躍する画家、Olga Alexopoulouの個展をUltraSuperNew galleryで開催いたします。イスタンブール・コンセプト・ギャラリーとヘラクレイドン美術館とのコラボレーションで実現する今回の個展では、「青」をテーマに、芸術と最先端のテクノロジーを掛け合わせた、彼女の画家として遂げる進化を明かします。

description.en:
Alexopoulou has spent years studying the color blue from antiquity to today, often travelling around the world to explore different blue pigments. The search for cobalt blue as it is used in the traditional way in blue & white porcelain, for example, took her to Jingdezhen, China, the capital of porcelain. Continuing her journey in the exploration of blue, Alexopoulou collaborated with the scientific laboratory that discovered plutonium, dark energy and the acceleration of the universe and subsequently created a new pigment. Confluencing nanoscientific principles and art, what is now called, Quantum Blue, is a pure color reminiscent of the period of a day known as the blue hour — that brief period of twilight before sunrise or after sunset.

The pigment is made out of quantum dots (inorganic nanocrystals made from semiconductors) and is blue in both absorption and luminescence. The concept was conceived by Alexopoulou and was taken on by Prof. Paul Alivisatos, an internationally recognized authority on the fabrication of nanocrystals. Nanotechnology scientists implemented the materials at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, in California, along with colour expert Maria Chatzidakis from the University of West Attica.
description.jp:
Alexopoulou は長年にわたり、古代から現代に至るまで様々な「青」の研究を続け、常に新たな「青」を求め世界中を旅してきました。古くから陶磁器に使用される顔料「コバルトブルー」を求めて辿り着いたのは、中国の都市、景徳鎮。青の探求し続ける道のりの中で、Alexopoulouは、プルトニウム、ダークエネルギーと加速膨張する宇宙を発見した科学研究室とコラボし、Quantum Blueを製作しました。「青の時間」と呼ばれる、日の出前や日の入り後短い時間見られる空の青色を髣髴とさせるQuantum Blueは、ナノ科学的原則と芸術分野の関係性を問う、新しい「青」の顔料です。

Quantum Blueの主な成分は量子ドット（無機ナノ粒子で構成された半導体）であり、吸収時と発光時に青く見えます。この顔料はAlexopoulou本人が考案し、ナノクリスタル製作の権威として国際的に有名な、ポール・アリヴィサトス教授が採用しました。カリフォルニアのローレンス・バークレー国立研究所でナノテクノロジーの科学者たちによって原料が提供され、西アッティカ大学の色素専門家Maria Chatzidakis と共に製作されました。

intro.en:
UltraSuperNew Gallery is thrilled to present, “Symbiose,” an exhibition featuring the works of Makio & Floz, a French collaborative unit whose works explore new ways of creating visuals through new media.

“Symbiose” is an installation featuring two digital paintings in constant evolution based on the organic process of symbiosis. The biological term refers to the interaction between two organisms living in close physical association. The two paintings, acting as organisms, have their own will but evolve in parallel. The paintings will demonstrate a range of interactions from synchronization to disaccord.
intro.jp: UltraSuperNew galleryはこのたび、新しいメディアを使い誰もみたことがないビジュアルを模索するフランス人アーティストユニット、Makio & Flozによる個展「Symbiose」を開催いたします。

description.en: The exhibit is a provocative exploration of contrasts as it integrates old and new elements such as sculptural paintings and projection mapping to dissect components and core themes of the natural world using technology. Pushing the boundaries of creativity, Makio & Floz injects technology into the center of their work. In doing so, they reinvent the gallery experience by creating dynamic installations that shed fresh and new perspectives on existing ideas. At its core,“Symbiose,” is an exhibition that celebrates the union between the past and present, natural and synthetic, in efforts to see what could be discovered next.
description.jp:
「Symbiose」は共生の有機プロセスに基づき、徐々に変化していく2つのデジタル絵画を展示するインスタレーションです。生き物に例えれば、2つの絵画は隣り合う環境に暮らし、お互いに影響しあっています。2つは意思があるかのように徐々に独自に動き、別々に進化していき、シンクロしたりしなくなったりと相互作用の過程を見せてくれます。

この展示では、テクノロジーを使い彫刻絵画のような昔からあるものと、プロジェクションマッピングのような新しいものを比較、融合させます。それにより、自然界を成り立たせる中心テーマを分析するという挑発的な内容です。コアにテクノロジーを据えたMakio & Floz の作品は、我々の既成概念を壊し、新しいギャラリー体験/視点を提案してくれます。過去と現在、自然と合成が溶け合い、次に何か起こるのかを提示する、それが「Symbiose」です。

intro.en:
UltraSuperNew Gallery will be presenting a series of new work by Louis Terai in an exhibition called Cyber Duchamp, from January 18 – 25, 2019.

Inspired by the works of French artist, Marcel Duchamp, Terai investigates the idea of authorship, ownership, and art production in the digital age in his new series of paintings. The paintings, purchased over an online marketplace, is encased in an unadorned acrylic box, which is defiantly signed by Terai. His decontextualized paintings addresses the ambiguity within artistic production and sheds light on how meaning can vary depending on its given context.

50 years later, Duchamp’s readymade sculptures are still a testament to the importance of challenging conventional notions of how art is defined. Cyber Duchamp is an exhibition where we can explore the role of the artist and how the digital sphere contributes to artist’s creative process.
intro.jp:
UltraSuperNew Galleryは1月18日〜1月25日の期間中、ルイ寺井の個展「Cyber Duchamp」を開催いたします。

フランスの芸術家、マーセルデューシャンプに影響され、デジタル世代で話題になっている所有権、著作権や芸術制作を新しいテーマとして昇華するルイ寺井。寺井本人がサインした絵画は、簡素なアクリルケースに保管され、オンライン上で売買されています。 彼の絵画は常識の枠にとらわれず、芸術制作の曖昧さを反映しながらも、状況によって絵画の意味や捉え方が変わることを表現しています。

五十年経っても、デューシャンプの彫刻を芸術で、それが『常識』だという考えに囚われることなく、真っ向と『当たり前』を疑うことの大切さを強調し、あらゆるものがデジタル化した生活が、どのように芸術家の作業工程に貢献しているかを探求しています。

intro.en:
UltraSuperNew Gallery is thrilled to present, SOS IN Bel Air’s first solo exhibition, Thunder Charger, in Harajuku from November 30th – December 6th, 2018.

The exhibition displays a series of installations and artwork that mixes tangible and intangible elements; creating an ambience that is both futuristic and ethereal. Visible motifs like movement and color intertwine with motifs that are ephemeral, such as sound and smoke; morphing a space that invites you to touch the intangible and find the invisible. Thunder Charger, in all its transient glory reverses our familiarity with how we view art and challenges us to see in between the spaces.
intro.jp:
